fields.headline: Villa try to tempt Taylor
fields.bodyText: Aston Villa are expected to ask Graham Taylor to become manager until the end of the season today when they hold their first board meeting since John Gregory s resignation. Taylor, who managed Villa between 1988 and 1990, joined the board as a non-executive director after retiring from club management last summer. But he is considered unlikely to accept the post. "I have told Doug [Ellis, the Villa chairman] that I will not become a club manager again," he had said last year. "Not [even] as a caretaker. Not even for a week." A temporary manager would enable Villa to assess their options, and possibly move for the Republic of Ireland manager Mick McCarthy, whose contract expires after the World Cup.
